name: unifi
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Unifi network resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`unifi` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/paultyng/terraform-provider-unifi).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Unifi network resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/paultyng/terraform-provider-unifi)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-unifi` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-unifi/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`paultyng/terraform-provider-unifi` repo](https://github.com/paultyng/terraform-provider-unifi/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/paultyng/terraform-provider-unifi)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-unifi` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-unifi/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`paultyng/terraform-provider-unifi` repo](https://github.com/paultyng/terraform-provider-unifi/issues).

allowInsecure.description:
Skip verification of TLS certificates of API requests. You may need to set this to `true` if you are using your local
API without setting up a signed certificate. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_INSECURE` environment variable.

apiUrl.description:
URL of the controller API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_API` environment variable. You should **NOT** supply the
path (`/api`), the SDK will discover the appropriate paths. This is to support UDM Pro style API paths as well as more
standard controller paths.

password.description: Password for the user accessing the API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_PASSWORD` environment variable.

site.description:
The site in the Unifi controller this provider will manage. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_SITE` environment variable.
Default: `default`

username.description: Local user name for the Unifi controller API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_USERNAME` environment variable.

name.description: Name of SSH key.

type.description: Type of SSH key, e.g. ssh-rsa.

name.description: Human-readable name of the port.

portProfileId.description: ID of the Port Profile used on this port.

blockEnd.description: Time of day to end the block.

blockStart.description: Time of day to start the block.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of week for the block. Valid values are `sun`, `mon`, `tue`, `wed`, `thu`, `fri`, `sat`.

provider.description:
The provider type for the unifi package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

allowInsecure.description:
Skip verification of TLS certificates of API requests. You may need to set this to `true` if you are using your local
API without setting up a signed certificate. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_INSECURE` environment variable.

apiUrl.description:
URL of the controller API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_API` environment variable. You should **NOT** supply the
path (`/api`), the SDK will discover the appropriate paths. This is to support UDM Pro style API paths as well as more
standard controller paths.

password.description: Password for the user accessing the API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_PASSWORD` environment variable.

site.description:
The site in the Unifi controller this provider will manage. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_SITE` environment variable.
Default: `default`

username.description: Local user name for the Unifi controller API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_USERNAME` environment variable.

API without setting up a signed certificate. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_INSECURE` environment variable.

apiUrl.description:
URL of the controller API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_API` environment variable. You should **NOT** supply the

password.description: Password for the user accessing the API. Can be specified with the `UNIFI_PASSWORD` environment variable.

unifi:Firewall/group:Group.description: `unifi.Firewall.Group` manages groups of addresses or ports for use in firewall rules (`unifi.Firewall.Rule`).

members.description: The members of the firewall group.

name.description: The name of the firewall group.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the firewall group with.

type.description: The type of the firewall group. Must be one of: `address-group`, `port-group`, or `ipv6-address-group`.

members.description: The members of the firewall group.

name.description: The name of the firewall group.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the firewall group with.

type.description: The type of the firewall group. Must be one of: `address-group`, `port-group`, or `ipv6-address-group`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Group resources.

members.description: The members of the firewall group.

name.description: The name of the firewall group.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the firewall group with.

type.description: The type of the firewall group. Must be one of: `address-group`, `port-group`, or `ipv6-address-group`.

unifi:Firewall/rule:Rule.description:
`unifi.Firewall.Rule` manages an individual firewall rule on the gateway.


## Import

# import using the ID from the controller API/UI

```sh
 $ pulumi import unifi:Firewall/rule:Rule my_rule 5f7080eb6b8969064f80494f
```

action.description: The action of the firewall rule. Must be one of `drop`, `accept`, or `reject`.

dstAddress.description: The destination address of the firewall rule.

dstFirewallGroupIds.description: The destination firewall group IDs of the firewall rule.

dstNetworkId.description: The destination network ID of the firewall rule.

dstNetworkType.description: The destination network type of the firewall rule. Can be one of `ADDRv4` or `NETv4`. Defaults to `NETv4`.

dstPort.description: The destination port of the firewall rule.

ipSec.description: Specify whether the rule matches on IPsec packets. Can be one of `match-ipset` or `match-none`.

logging.description: Enable logging for the firewall rule.

name.description: The name of the firewall rule.

ruleIndex.description: The index of the rule. Must be >= 2000 < 3000 or >= 4000 < 5000.

ruleset.description: The ruleset for the rule. This is from the perspective of the security gateway. Must be one of `WAN_IN`, `WAN_OUT`, `WAN_LOCAL`, `LAN_IN`, `LAN_OUT`, `LAN_LOCAL`, `GUEST_IN`, `GUEST_OUT`, `GUEST_LOCAL`, `WANv6_IN`, `WANv6_OUT`, `WANv6_LOCAL`, `LANv6_IN`, `LANv6_OUT`, `LANv6_LOCAL`, `GUESTv6_IN`, `GUESTv6_OUT`, or `GUESTv6_LOCAL`.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the firewall rule with.

srcAddress.description: The source address for the firewall rule.

srcFirewallGroupIds.description: The source firewall group IDs for the firewall rule.

srcMac.description: The source MAC address of the firewall rule.

srcNetworkId.description: The source network ID for the firewall rule.

srcNetworkType.description: The source network type of the firewall rule. Can be one of `ADDRv4` or `NETv4`. Defaults to `NETv4`.

stateEstablished.description: Match where the state is established.

stateInvalid.description: Match where the state is invalid.

stateNew.description: Match where the state is new.

stateRelated.description: Match where the state is related.

unifi:IAM/user:User.description:
`unifi.IAM.User` manages a user (or "client" in the UI) of the network, these are identified by unique MAC addresses.

Users are created in the controller when observed on the network, so the resource defaults to allowing itself to just take over management of a MAC address, but this can be turned off.

allowExisting.description: Specifies whether this resource should just take over control of an existing user. Defaults to `true`.

blocked.description: Specifies whether this user should be blocked from the network.

fixedIp.description: A fixed IPv4 address for this user.

ip.description: The IP address of the user.

mac.description: The MAC address of the user.

name.description: The name of the user.

networkId.description: The network ID for this user.

note.description: A note with additional information for the user.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the user with.

skipForgetOnDestroy.description: Specifies whether this resource should tell the controller to "forget" the user on destroy. Defaults to `false`.

userGroupId.description: The user group ID for the user.

allowExisting.description: Specifies whether this resource should just take over control of an existing user. Defaults to `true`.

blocked.description: Specifies whether this user should be blocked from the network.

fixedIp.description: A fixed IPv4 address for this user.

mac.description: The MAC address of the user.

name.description: The name of the user.

networkId.description: The network ID for this user.

note.description: A note with additional information for the user.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the user with.

skipForgetOnDestroy.description: Specifies whether this resource should tell the controller to "forget" the user on destroy. Defaults to `false`.

userGroupId.description: The user group ID for the user.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering User resources.

allowExisting.description: Specifies whether this resource should just take over control of an existing user. Defaults to `true`.

blocked.description: Specifies whether this user should be blocked from the network.

skipForgetOnDestroy.description: Specifies whether this resource should tell the controller to "forget" the user on destroy. Defaults to `false`.

userGroupId.description: The user group ID for the user.

unifi:Port/forward:Forward.description: `unifi.Port.Forward` manages a port forwarding rule on the gateway.

dstPort.description: The destination port for the forwarding.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the port forwarding rule is enabled or not. This will attribute will be removed in a future release. Instead of disabling a port forwarding rule you can remove it from your configuration.
enabled.deprecationMessage: This will attribute will be removed in a future release. Instead of disabling a port forwarding rule you can remove it from your configuration.

fwdIp.description: The IPv4 address to forward traffic to.

fwdPort.description: The port to forward traffic to.

log.description: Specifies whether to log forwarded traffic or not. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the port forwarding rule.

portForwardInterface.description: The port forwarding interface. Can be `wan`, `wan2`, or `both`.

protocol.description: The protocol for the port forwarding rule. Can be `tcp`, `udp`, or `tcp_udp`. Defaults to `tcp_udp`.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the port forwarding rule with.

srcIp.description: The source IPv4 address (or CIDR) of the port forwarding rule. For all traffic, specify `any`. Defaults to `any`.

dstPort.description: The destination port for the forwarding.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the port forwarding rule is enabled or not. This will attribute will be removed in a future release. Instead of disabling a port forwarding rule you can remove it from your configuration.
enabled.deprecationMessage: This will attribute will be removed in a future release. Instead of disabling a port forwarding rule you can remove it from your configuration.

fwdIp.description: The IPv4 address to forward traffic to.

fwdPort.description: The port to forward traffic to.

log.description: Specifies whether to log forwarded traffic or not. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the port forwarding rule.

portForwardInterface.description: The port forwarding interface. Can be `wan`, `wan2`, or `both`.

protocol.description: The protocol for the port forwarding rule. Can be `tcp`, `udp`, or `tcp_udp`. Defaults to `tcp_udp`.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the port forwarding rule with.

srcIp.description: The source IPv4 address (or CIDR) of the port forwarding rule. For all traffic, specify `any`. Defaults to `any`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Forward resources.

dstPort.description: The destination port for the forwarding.

enabled.description: Specifies whether the port forwarding rule is enabled or not. This will attribute will be removed in a future release. Instead of disabling a port forwarding rule you can remove it from your configuration.
enabled.deprecationMessage: This will attribute will be removed in a future release. Instead of disabling a port forwarding rule you can remove it from your configuration.

fwdIp.description: The IPv4 address to forward traffic to.

fwdPort.description: The port to forward traffic to.

log.description: Specifies whether to log forwarded traffic or not. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the port forwarding rule.

portForwardInterface.description: The port forwarding interface. Can be `wan`, `wan2`, or `both`.

protocol.description: The protocol for the port forwarding rule. Can be `tcp`, `udp`, or `tcp_udp`. Defaults to `tcp_udp`.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the port forwarding rule with.

srcIp.description: The source IPv4 address (or CIDR) of the port forwarding rule. For all traffic, specify `any`. Defaults to `any`.

unifi:Port/profile:Profile.description: `unifi.Port.Profile` manages a port profile for use on network switches.

autoneg.description: Enable link auto negotiation for the port profile. When set to `true` this overrides `speed`. Defaults to `true`.

dot1xCtrl.description: The type of 802.1X control to use. Can be `auto`, `force_authorized`, `force_unauthorized`, `mac_based` or `multi_host`. Defaults to `force_authorized`.

dot1xIdleTimeout.description: The timeout, in seconds, to use when using the MAC Based 802.1X control. Can be between 0 and 65535 Defaults to `300`.

egressRateLimitKbps.description: The egress rate limit, in kpbs, for the port profile. Can be between `64` and `9999999`.

egressRateLimitKbpsEnabled.description: Enable egress rate limiting for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

forward.description: The type forwarding to use for the port profile. Can be `all`, `native`, `customize` or `disabled`. Defaults to `native`.

fullDuplex.description: Enable full duplex for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

isolation.description: Enable port isolation for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

lldpmedEnabled.description: Enable LLDP-MED for the port profile. Defaults to `true`.

lldpmedNotifyEnabled.description: Enable LLDP-MED topology change notifications for the port profile.

name.description: The name of the port profile.

nativeNetworkconfId.description: The ID of network to use as the main network on the port profile.

opMode.description: The operation mode for the port profile. Can only be `switch` Defaults to `switch`.

poeMode.description: The POE mode for the port profile. Can be one of `auto`, `passv24`, `passthrough` or `off`.

portSecurityEnabled.description: Enable port security for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

portSecurityMacAddresses.description: The MAC addresses associated with the port security for the port profile.

priorityQueue1Level.description: The priority queue 1 level for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 100.

priorityQueue2Level.description: The priority queue 2 level for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 100.

priorityQueue3Level.description: The priority queue 3 level for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 100.

priorityQueue4Level.description: The priority queue 4 level for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 100.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the port profile with.

stormctrlBcastEnabled.description: Enable broadcast Storm Control for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

stormctrlBcastLevel.description: The broadcast Storm Control level for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 100.

stormctrlBcastRate.description: The broadcast Storm Control rate for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 14880000.

stormctrlMcastEnabled.description: Enable multicast Storm Control for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

stormctrlMcastLevel.description: The multicast Storm Control level for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 100.

stormctrlMcastRate.description: The multicast Storm Control rate for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 14880000.

stormctrlType.description: The type of Storm Control to use for the port profile. Can be one of `level` or `rate`.

stormctrlUcastEnabled.description: Enable unknown unicast Storm Control for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

stormctrlUcastLevel.description: The unknown unicast Storm Control level for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 100.

stormctrlUcastRate.description: The unknown unicast Storm Control rate for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 14880000.

stpPortMode.description: Enable spanning tree protocol on the port profile. Defaults to `true`.

taggedNetworkconfIds.description: The IDs of networks to tag traffic with for the port profile.

voiceNetworkconfId.description: The ID of network to use as the voice network on the port profile.

autoneg.description: Enable link auto negotiation for the port profile. When set to `true` this overrides `speed`. Defaults to `true`.

dot1xCtrl.description: The type of 802.1X control to use. Can be `auto`, `force_authorized`, `force_unauthorized`, `mac_based` or `multi_host`. Defaults to `force_authorized`.

dot1xIdleTimeout.description: The timeout, in seconds, to use when using the MAC Based 802.1X control. Can be between 0 and 65535 Defaults to `300`.

egressRateLimitKbps.description: The egress rate limit, in kpbs, for the port profile. Can be between `64` and `9999999`.

egressRateLimitKbpsEnabled.description: Enable egress rate limiting for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

forward.description: The type forwarding to use for the port profile. Can be `all`, `native`, `customize` or `disabled`. Defaults to `native`.

isolation.description: Enable port isolation for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

lldpmedEnabled.description: Enable LLDP-MED for the port profile. Defaults to `true`.

lldpmedNotifyEnabled.description: Enable LLDP-MED topology change notifications for the port profile.

name.description: The name of the port profile.

nativeNetworkconfId.description: The ID of network to use as the main network on the port profile.

opMode.description: The operation mode for the port profile. Can only be `switch` Defaults to `switch`.

poeMode.description: The POE mode for the port profile. Can be one of `auto`, `passv24`, `passthrough` or `off`.

portSecurityEnabled.description: Enable port security for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

portSecurityMacAddresses.description: The MAC addresses associated with the port security for the port profile.

stormctrlUcastEnabled.description: Enable unknown unicast Storm Control for the port profile. Defaults to `false`.

stormctrlUcastRate.description: The unknown unicast Storm Control rate for the port profile. Can be between 0 and 14880000.

stpPortMode.description: Enable spanning tree protocol on the port profile. Defaults to `true`.

taggedNetworkconfIds.description: The IDs of networks to tag traffic with for the port profile.

voiceNetworkconfId.description: The ID of network to use as the voice network on the port profile.

unifi:index/network:Network.description:
`unifi.Network` manages WAN/LAN/VLAN networks.


## Import

# import from provider configured site

```sh
 $ pulumi import unifi:index/network:Network mynetwork 5dc28e5e9106d105bdc87217
```

 # import from another site

```sh
 $ pulumi import unifi:index/network:Network mynetwork bfa2l6i7:5dc28e5e9106d105bdc87217
```

 # import network by name

```sh
 $ pulumi import unifi:index/network:Network mynetwork name=LAN
```

dhcpDns.description: Specifies the IPv4 addresses for the DNS server to be returned from the DHCP server. Leave blank to disable this feature.

dhcpEnabled.description: Specifies whether DHCP is enabled or not on this network.

dhcpLease.description: Specifies the lease time for DHCP addresses. Defaults to `86400`.

dhcpRelayEnabled.description: Specifies whether DHCP relay is enabled or not on this network.

dhcpStart.description: The IPv4 address where the DHCP range of addresses starts.

dhcpStop.description: The IPv4 address where the DHCP range of addresses stops.

dhcpdBootEnabled.description: Toggles on the DHCP boot options. Should be set to true when you want to have dhcpd*boot*filename, and dhcpd*boot*server to take effect.

dhcpdBootFilename.description: Specifies the file to PXE boot from on the dhcpd*boot*server.

dhcpdBootServer.description: Specifies the IPv4 address of a TFTP server to network boot from.

domainName.description: The domain name of this network.

igmpSnooping.description: Specifies whether IGMP snooping is enabled or not.

ipv6InterfaceType.description: Specifies which type of IPv6 connection to use. Defaults to `none`.

ipv6PdInterface.description: Specifies which WAN interface to use for IPv6 PD.

ipv6RaEnable.description: Specifies whether to enable router advertisements or not.

ipv6StaticSubnet.description: Specifies the static IPv6 subnet when ipv6*interface*type is 'static'.

name.description: The name of the network.

networkGroup.description: The group of the network. Defaults to `LAN`.

purpose.description: The purpose of the network. Must be one of `corporate`, `guest`, `wan`, or `vlan-only`.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the network with.

subnet.description: The subnet of the network. Must be a valid CIDR address.

vlanId.description: The VLAN ID of the network.

wanDns.description: DNS servers IPs of the WAN.

wanEgressQos.description: Specifies the WAN egress quality of service. Defaults to `0`.

wanGateway.description: The IPv4 gateway of the WAN.

wanIp.description: The IPv4 address of the WAN.

wanNetmask.description: The IPv4 netmask of the WAN.

wanNetworkgroup.description: Specifies the WAN network group. Must be one of either `WAN`, `WAN2` or `WAN_LTE_FAILOVER`.

wanType.description: Specifies the IPV4 WAN connection type. Must be one of either `disabled`, `static`, `dhcp`, or `pppoe`.

unifi:index/wlan:Wlan.description:
`unifi.Wlan` manages a WiFi network / SSID.


## Import

# import from provider configured site

```sh
 $ pulumi import unifi:index/wlan:Wlan mywlan 5dc28e5e9106d105bdc87217
```

 # import from another site

```sh
 $ pulumi import unifi:index/wlan:Wlan mywlan bfa2l6i7:5dc28e5e9106d105bdc87217
```

apGroupIds.description: IDs of the AP groups to use for this network.

hideSsid.description: Indicates whether or not to hide the SSID from broadcast.

isGuest.description: Indicates that this is a guest WLAN and should use guest behaviors.

l2Isolation.description: Isolates stations on layer 2 (ethernet) level Defaults to `false`.

macFilterEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not the MAC filter is turned of for the network.

macFilterLists.description: List of MAC addresses to filter (only valid if `mac_filter_enabled` is `true`).

macFilterPolicy.description: MAC address filter policy (only valid if `mac_filter_enabled` is `true`). Defaults to `deny`.

minimumDataRate2gKbps.description: Set minimum data rate control for 2G devices, in Kbps. Use `0` to disable minimum data rates. Valid values are: `1000`, `2000`, `5500`, `6000`, `9000`, `11000`, `12000`, `18000`, `24000`, `36000`, `48000`,  and `54000`.

minimumDataRate5gKbps.description: Set minimum data rate control for 5G devices, in Kbps. Use `0` to disable minimum data rates. Valid values are: `6000`, `9000`, `12000`, `18000`, `24000`, `36000`, `48000`,  and `54000`.

multicastEnhance.description: Indicates whether or not Multicast Enhance is turned of for the network.

name.description: The SSID of the network.

networkId.description: ID of the network for this SSID

no2ghzOui.description: Connect high performance clients to 5 GHz only Defaults to `true`.

passphrase.description: The passphrase for the network, this is only required if `security` is not set to `open`.

pmfMode.description: Enable Protected Management Frames. This cannot be disabled if using WPA 3. Valid values are `required`, `optional` and `disabled`. Defaults to `disabled`.

radiusProfileId.description: ID of the RADIUS profile to use when security `wpaeap`. You can query this via the `unifi.getRadiusProfile` data source.

schedules.description: Start and stop schedules for the WLAN

security.description: The type of WiFi security for this network. Valid values are: `wpapsk`, `wpaeap`, and `open`.

site.description: The name of the site to associate the wlan with.

uapsd.description: Enable Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery Defaults to `false`.

userGroupId.description: ID of the user group to use for this network.

wlanBand.description: Radio band your WiFi network will use.

wpa3Support.description: Enable WPA 3 support (security must be `wpapsk` and PMF must be turned on).

wpa3Transition.description: Enable WPA 3 and WPA 2 support (security must be `wpapsk` and `wpa3_support` must be true).

note.description: A note with additional information for the user.

purpose.description: The purpose of the network. One of `corporate`, `guest`, `wan`, or `vlan-only`.
